page.title: 06THE BADMINTON ESTATE.
page.content: Most of the land covered in our area is park land which is enclosed grazing of permanent pasture with some improvements;farmland growing corn and intensively managed grassland and ancient deciduous woodlands.The area forms part of the Home Farm on the Badminton Estate.All the land is held in hand.The work force includes farm staff and game keepers.The deer are primarily Park deer but becoming an increasing commercial concern.The numbers of deer are approx:300 Red deer and 30 Fallow deer.The Hermit's cell is an 18th. century folly made of tree roots.There is coarse fishing in Park Pond.The Oak Plantation marked is an ancient deciduous woodland.There are no plans for development in any area of the park above Badminton House.
